full_text.3: With the Bezos $$ announcement, a good time to encourage everyone to read "Winners Take All" by Anand Giridharadas - one of the the best books I've ever read. The wealthiest wreak havoc to make their billions and then claim to fix it by philanthropy. https://t.co/Twx2sfk0x1
full_text.4: “This is a giant statement, not just because of the amount of wealth he has, but because he might really have a ripple effect on what others choose to do.” https://t.co/ROmHQrkgmi
full_text.5: @DavidAFrench Then you have people like Gates, Bezos, Jobs, Ellison, who really do have what it takes for that role. And also the smarts to stick with what they know and not get lost in the idea that their genius applies to everything. None of them would have bought a social media company.

@suzseddon Automation makes employees unnecessary. It won’t just be Bezos. It’ll be all businesses. Fast food, delivery, vending. Most jobs can be automated. 

What they don’t realize, is those replaceable people won’t have money to buy their crap.

full_text.10: @ABC Disgusting. Don't get me wrong, I adore Dolly. It's Jeff Bezos that makes me sick. He treats his warehouse employees like trash. My husband made it 2 years. He was over worked and severely under paid. Let's talk about mandatory overtime during peak season and no time off allowed.
